abstract: The previous color texture for this frame interpolator during the last call to encode work into a command buffer.
overview:
## Discussion

The frame interpolator typically uses the previous color texture as part of its operation. When you call [doc://com.apple.metalfx/documentation/MetalFX/MTLFXFrameInterpolator/encode(commandBuffer:)] and its [doc://com.apple.metalfx/documentation/MetalFX/MTLFXFrameInterpolatorBase/shouldResetHistory] property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false], then you are responsible for assigning to this property the data that in [doc://com.apple.metalfx/documentation/MetalFX/MTLFXFrameInterpolatorBase/colorTexture] from the previous call to [doc://com.apple.metalfx/documentation/MetalFX/MTLFXFrameInterpolator/encode(commandBuffer:)].

Additionally, you are responsible for ensuring the usage and pixel format of the texture you assign to this property matches the texture usage [doc://com.apple.metalfx/documentation/MetalFX/MTLFXFrameInterpolatorBase/colorTextureUsage] requests and the pixel format that [doc://com.apple.metalfx/documentation/MetalFX/MTLFXFrameInterpolatorBase/colorTextureFormat] requests.

# prevColorTexture

**Instance Property**

The previous color texture for this frame interpolator during the last call to encode work into a command buffer.

## Declaration

```swift
var prevColorTexture: (any MTLTexture)? { get set }
```

## Discussion

The frame interpolator typically uses the previous color texture as part of its operation. When you call [doc://com.apple.metalfx/documentation/MetalFX/MTLFXFrameInterpolator/encode(commandBuffer:)] and its [doc://com.apple.metalfx/documentation/MetalFX/MTLFXFrameInterpolatorBase/shouldResetHistory] property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false], then you are responsible for assigning to this property the data that in [doc://com.apple.metalfx/documentation/MetalFX/MTLFXFrameInterpolatorBase/colorTexture] from the previous call to [doc://com.apple.metalfx/documentation/MetalFX/MTLFXFrameInterpolator/encode(commandBuffer:)].

Additionally, you are responsible for ensuring the usage and pixel format of the texture you assign to this property matches the texture usage [doc://com.apple.metalfx/documentation/MetalFX/MTLFXFrameInterpolatorBase/colorTextureUsage] requests and the pixel format that [doc://com.apple.metalfx/documentation/MetalFX/MTLFXFrameInterpolatorBase/colorTextureFormat] requests.
title: prevColorTexture
